projectPurpose: To provide a comprehensive and modular set of standards and implementations for network fingerprinting across various protocols, improving network security analysis, threat hunting, and the identification of malicious activity in encrypted traffic.
mainFeatures: Suite of network fingerprinting methods (JA4, JA4S, JA4H, JA4L, JA4X, JA4SSH, JA4T, JA4TS, JA4TScan)
Fingerprinting for multiple protocols (TLS, HTTP, SSH, TCP, QUIC, X.509 certificates)
Modular fingerprint format (a_b_c) allowing for granular analysis

alternatives.name: JA3/JA3S
alternatives.platforms: Platform-independent (method/standard), implementations available for various platforms/tools

alternatives.name: HASSH
alternatives.platforms: Platform-independent (method/standard), implementations available in various tools

alternatives.name: Zeek
mainFeatures: Scripting for custom analysis and detection
Supports various fingerprinting techniques (JA3, HASSH, etc. via scripts)

alternatives.name: Fatt
mainFeatures: Supports various protocols (HTTP, SSH, SSL/TLS, RDP)

alternatives.name: JARM
mainFeatures: Generates a fuzzy hash for identification

marketPositioning: JA4+ is positioned as the next-generation suite of network fingerprinting standards, succeeding and improving upon the widely adopted JA3. It differentiates itself by offering broader protocol support, a modular and human-readable fingerprint format for granular analysis, improved evasion resistance, and extensibility. It serves as a foundational technology for network security, providing advanced fingerprinting capabilities that can be integrated into various existing security tools and platforms (NSM, IDS/IPS, threat intelligence) to enhance visibility and threat detection in encrypted traffic. Its competition lies primarily with older, less comprehensive fingerprinting standards and the fingerprinting capabilities built into broader security platforms.
